lines.content: Aurora is a simple chatbot application designed to help users manage tasks via a command-line or GUI interface.
It supports adding todos, deadlines, events, tagging, searching, and more.
Tasks are automatically saved after sessions and loaded before sessions.
- Words in _UPPER_CASE_ are parameters to be supplied by the user.
e.g. in `todo DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` is the parameter.
- Commands support both Date and Datetime format,
you must follow one of the below formats for Aurora to correctly parse your Deadline or Event datetime.
Adds a simple todo task to your list.
Added Read a book as a task into your list.
Adds a task with a deadline to your list
Added Math quiz as a task into your list.
Adds an event with a start and end time to your list.
Added Project meeting as a task into your list.
Displays all tasks currently in your list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Nice! I've marked this task as completed.
Removes a task from your list.
Now you have 2 tasks in your list.
Finds all tasks containing the given keywords. Works for finding tags as well.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Adds a tag to tasks for easier categorisation.
Great. I've tagged this task as math.
Great. This task is no longer tagged math.
List out all available commands and formats for user.
* Aurora is a simple task management chatbot that runs on the command line.
* It allows user to add, list, mark as done, and delete tasks.
* Saving and loading between sessions is supported and tasks are stored in a text file on disk.
* @param filePath path to the file used for saving and loading tasks
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.
assert input != null && !input.isBlank() : "Input string cannot be null or empty";

* The {@code Main} class serves as the entry point for the JavaFX application.
* It initializes the primary stage, loads the FXML layout, and sets up
* the {@link Aurora} instance for use in the UI controller.
private final Aurora aurora = new Aurora();

return "Added " + task.getDescription() + " as a task into your list.";

// Regex for mark, delete, and find commands to extract the integer/string after the command
private static final Pattern MARK = Pattern.compile("^mark\\s+(\\d+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
private static final Pattern DELETE = Pattern.compile("^delete\\s+(\\d+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
private static final Pattern FIND = Pattern.compile("^find\\s+(.+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
private static final Pattern TAG = Pattern.compile("^tag\\s+(\\d+)\\s+(.+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
private static final Pattern UNTAG = Pattern.compile("^untag\\s+(\\d+)\\s+(.+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);

* Command to display all existing commands.
// Help command text expanded to include all commands supported by CommandReader.
// AI assistance used for formatting and ensuring consistency with existing commands.
To mark a task complete:     mark <task number>
To delete a task:            delete <task number>
To find tasks by keyword:    find <keyword>
To tag a task:               tag <task number> <tag>
To remove a tag:             untag <task number> <tag>
To exit Aurora:              bye / close the app
To see this help message:    help

* Command to tag specified task from task list with given string.

assert tag != null && !tag.isBlank() : "Tag cannot be null or empty";

return "Great. I've tagged this task as " + tag + ".\n" + task;
* Command to tag specified task from task list with given string.

assert tag != null && !tag.isBlank() : "Tag cannot be null or empty";
return "There is no task numbered " + index + ".";
return "Great. This task is no longer tagged " + tag + ".\n" + task;
